reviews.text: The previous reviews are correct - this is a lovely hotel, with a fascinating history. Don't expect luxury, do expect a great experience at a bargain price. You will never find proprietors more friendly and welcoming, and the area is very aptly named (Vallehermoso = beautiful valley). The town is pleasant, with some reasonable restaurants and bars. The hotel overlooks it and the valley beyond and so many rooms - certainly ours - have wonderful views. The rooms are clean and simply but tastefully decorated, and the food is really good. The small dining room is very conducive to friendly conversations with other guests. There's also a small but beautiful garden area, and a shaded table on a terrace overlooking the valley which is delightful when its hot. You can get teas, coffees etc brought out for a very reasonable charge.
reviews.title: wonderful - don't miss this hotel

reviews.text: If you're a hiker you could easily spend a few days walking, with varying degrees of strenuousness, from the hotel. In addition to climbing up the valley (as described in the previous review) you can also walk down c 4 kms to a small beach - too rough for swimming alas so there is a summer lido. A German artist has restored an old building there and turned it into a small gallery, cafe and occasional performance venue - see www.castillo-del-mar.com. It has a dramatic location on a wave pounded promontory, and beautiful views of the coast, Tenerife and La Palma. We were fortunate to have nice weather and I don't think we've ever been in a more inspiring location. (NB Although the road down from the hotel is fairly quiet, you can bypass part of it by walking on the trail by the barranco that farmers use to access their crops - which are themselves fascinating to see. Never seen avocados growing on trees before! You can also access a neglected but fascinating botanical garden this way.)
reviews.title: Rustic bliss!

likes.liked: — The views and the friendly owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only two very minor downsides - parking as mentioned (we parked down on the main square and could see the car from our room), and some noise from cockerels and dogs which, although some way away, seems to be magnified by an 'echo chamber' effect from the valley walls. Neither should stop you staying here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lovely place and what lovely hosts in Amala and Herman! We stayed in the ground floor apartment which was perfect for us and had an amazing view of the sleepy village below. If you're a vegetarian you are in luck as they produce fantatsic hearty veggie meals in a beautiful and cosy dining room. They sorted out car hire for us and had the perfect mix of being available to chat but not intrusive. We left them with a few DVDs (there is a player and small TV n the apartment), including 'Burn After Reading' - don't bother with that tho', it's rubbish! Highly recommended, we would love to go back.
reviews.title: Perfect hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this beautiful and very interestingly laid out building and garden with fantastic views in January 2009. We enjoyed it so much that we are going to stay there again next week (Feb 2010). We are very much looking forward to it.
reviews.title: Could Not Fault Hotel Anaterve If We Tried !!!

reviews.text: As it says in the previous reviews, the owners could not be more helpful, friendly and accomodating if they tried . . . A very pleasant couple indeed. Herman even drove and parked my hire car for me when I was getting a bit nervous about the narrow road and steep slopes just outside the hotel. (I never was a very good driver !)
reviews.title: PARADISE on EARTH

reviews.text: One point that has not been stressed enough by other reviewers is that all the food served at Hotel Anaterve is 100% top quality and totally vegetarian. They really are excellent cooks ! For veggies like us, this would always be fantastic but it is an exceptionally welcome treat if you are staying on La Gomera for a couple of weeks. There a very few other restaurants on the island where (as non-Spanish speakers) you can easily order a decent vegetarian meal.
reviews.title: All we needed... and more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here is a tip that might help you if you are staying at Hotel Anaterve for the first time and arriving in Vallehermoso by car . . . Unless you have a far better satnav than us, you probably will get navigated only as far as the town centre. There is one big free car park in centre of town. The hotel is perched high on the slopes above it.
reviews.title: Had a nice home-feel to it!
